newsitem.title: LATVIA: Latvian stocks in negative teritory, trade quiet.
newsitem.headline: Latvian stocks in negative teritory, trade quiet.

text.p: Latvian shares slipped lower on Friday and total turnover halved as the market maintained its recent state of dormancy.
The Rietumu index slipped 0.71 percent to 182.76 and activity was 35,000 lats versus 65,000 lats as 16 stocks were not traded.
"Small investors are inactive ahead of the weekend and the big ones are waiting for the appeareance of new companies," said Harijs Zulgis, trader at Rigas kommercbanka.
He mentioned Olainfarm, which makes its trade debut on the bourse next week, and Liepajas metalurgs, coming soon after.
Unibanka led the official list market with turnover of 9,000 lats but was stable at 3.40 lats.
Staburadze again made a small gain of one santime to 2.70 lats on turnover of 3,300 lats.
On the secondary market, Valmiera Glassfibre was most active, beating Unibanka on the official list, as it traded 12,700 lats and slipped 2.6 percent to 1.50 lats.
